examples.description: Series B SaaS company with $18M ARR, 125% NRR, recently doubled sales team, operating in enterprise collaboration space with strong product-market fit.
examples.analysis: SaaS Scale-up baseline (55% growth). Strong NRR above 120% is a major positive. Recently scaled sales team suggests growth investment. Position at higher end of range with upward adjustments.

result.reasoning: Series B SaaS with excellent retention metrics and aggressive sales investment signals continued high growth trajectory

examples.description: Fintech startup with $3M revenue, recently obtained banking license, facing increased regulatory compliance costs and competitor pricing pressure.
examples.analysis: Fintech Startup baseline (100% growth). Regulatory license is a milestone but compliance costs increase. Pricing pressure is a negative. Moderate downward adjustment.

result.reasoning: Early fintech with regulatory approval but facing cost headwinds and competitive pressure on pricing

examples.description: Manufacturing SMB with $25M revenue, stable customer base, no major expansion plans, benefiting from nearshoring trends in the industry.
examples.analysis: Manufacturing SMB baseline (8% growth). Stable customer base is neutral. Macroeconomic tailwind from nearshoring. Slight upward adjustment.

result.reasoning: Traditional manufacturing benefiting from industry tailwinds but no aggressive growth initiatives

examples.description: E-commerce startup with $8M GMV, 85% NRR indicating churn issues, but launching major new product line and expanding into European markets.
examples.analysis: E-commerce Startup baseline (120% growth). Weak NRR is significant negative. Product expansion and geographic expansion are positives. Net moderate downward adjustment due to churn concerns.

result.reasoning: High-growth e-commerce with concerning retention offset partially by expansion initiatives

examples.description: Professional services firm with $12M revenue, strong reputation in niche market, experiencing high consultant turnover and delayed project deliveries.
examples.analysis: Consulting SMB baseline (18% growth). High turnover is a significant operational challenge. Delays affect client satisfaction and repeat business. Downward adjustment.

result.reasoning: Consulting firm with talent retention issues impacting delivery and growth capacity
